title: E93-1066

sentences.text: This poster paper describes a full scale two-level morphological description -LRB- Karttunen , 1983 ; Koskenniemi , 1983 -RRB- of Turkish word structures .
The description has been implemented using the PC-KIMMO environment -LRB- Antworth , 1990 -RRB- and is based on a root word lexicon of about 23,000 roots words .
Almost all the special cases of and exceptions to phonological and morphological rules have been implemented .
Turkish is an agglutinative language with word structures formed by productive affixations of derivational and inflectional suffixes to root words .
Turkish has finite-state but nevertheless rather complex morphotactics .
Morphemes added to a root word or a stem can convert the word from a nominal to a verbal structure or vice-versa , or can create adverbial constructs .
The surface realizations of morphological constructions are constrained and modified by a number of phonetic rules such as vowel harmony .

summary: This poster paper describes a full scale two-level morphological description -LRB- Karttunen , 1983 ; Koskenniemi , 1983 -RRB- of Turkish word structures . The description has been implemented using the PC-KIMMO environment -LRB- Antworth , 1990 -RRB- and is based on a root word lexicon of about 23,000 roots words . Almost all the special cases of and exceptions to phonological and morphological rules have been implemented . Turkish is an agglutinative language with word structures formed by productive affixations of derivational and inflectional suffixes to root words . Turkish has finite-state but nevertheless rather complex morphotactics . Morphemes added to a root word or a stem can convert the word from a nominal to a verbal structure or vice-versa , or can create adverbial constructs . The surface realizations of morphological constructions are constrained and modified by a number of phonetic rules such as vowel harmony .

Predicate-is.label: is
Predicate-is.description: The predicate 'is' connects a subject to an object by indicating that they share a common attribute or characteristic. It establishes an equivalence relationship between the two, suggesting that the subject and object are identical with respect to some property.

Predicate-described_by.label: described by
Predicate-described_by.description: The predicate 'described by' indicates a relationship where the subject (e.g. Turkish word structures) has its characteristics or features explained or outlined through the object (e.g. This poster paper). The object serves as a medium that provides an account, explanation, or representation of the subject's properties.

Predicate-has_been_implemented_using.label: has been implemented using
Predicate-has_been_implemented_using.description: Indicates that a process or system was developed and executed utilizing a specific tool, framework, software, or methodology. This predicate highlights the connection between an entity (the subject) and its implementation method (the object), emphasizing the role of the latter in bringing the former into being.

Predicate-used_for_implementation.label: used for implementation
Predicate-used_for_implementation.description: Indicates that a resource (subject) serves as a means to create or develop something else (object), often implying a specific purpose or function.

Predicate-is_an.label: is an
Predicate-is_an.description: The predicate 'is an' indicates a classification or categorization relationship between the subject and object. It suggests that the subject possesses the characteristics, properties, or attributes described by the object, which can be a noun phrase, adjective, or other type of descriptor.

Predicate-has.label: has
Predicate-has.description: The predicate 'has' indicates a relationship between two entities where one (the subject) possesses or is characterized by another (the object). It implies ownership, association, or inherent quality.

Predicate-convert.label: convert
Predicate-convert.description: The predicate 'convert' indicates a transformational relationship between the subject and object, where the subject (typically an entity capable of modification) brings about a change in the structure or form of the object (often a linguistic unit), resulting in a new or modified state.

Predicate-characterized.label: characterized
Predicate-characterized.description: The predicate 'characterized' indicates that a description or characteristic is provided for the subject, which serves as an explanation or illustration of what makes the subject unique. It establishes a connection between the subject and object by stating how the subject can be understood or defined through its relationship with the described property.

Predicate-describes.label: describes
Predicate-describes.description: The predicate 'describes' indicates a relationship between its subject and object where the subject provides an explanation, characterization, or definition of the object. It suggests that the subject has a comprehensive understanding of the object's nature, properties, or characteristics.

Predicate-describe.label: describe
Predicate-describe.description: To characterize or outline the essential features of something, typically providing a concise and informative representation.

Predicate-is_based_on.label: is based on
Predicate-is_based_on.description: Indicates that a subject's characteristics or properties are derived from or grounded in an object. The predicate 'is based on' suggests a relationship of dependence, where the subject relies on the object for its definition, explanation, or justification.

Predicate-is_described_using.label: is described using
Predicate-is_described_using.description: This predicate indicates a relationship between a subject (a piece of text or content) and an object (a language), suggesting that the subject is conveyed or expressed using the specified language.

Predicate-is_an_agglutinative_language_w.label: is an agglutinative language with word structures formed by productive affixations of derivational and inflectional suffixes to root words
Predicate-is_an_agglutinative_language_w.description: This predicate describes a linguistic property that connects the subject (a language) with its characteristic word structure, highlighting how it is formed through the combination of productive affixations and root words. The predicate establishes a relationship between the subject and object by stating that the former exhibits the latter's structural features.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates that the subject concept is subsumed by or more specifically defined as the object concept. In other words, it denotes an is-a relationship between two concepts where the subject is a narrower or more specific instance of the object.
